intro: Solanum alandiae, commonly known as the Aland Islands nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Aland Islands in the Baltic Sea. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, tomatoes, and potatoes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring simple, oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Its berries are usually red when mature and contain the seeds, though the plant is not widely cultivated for agricultural purposes.
